title: Pan-Seared Tilapia
summary: Pan-Seared Tilapia might be a good recipe to expand your main course recipe box. This recipe makes 4 servings with 247 calories, 24g of protein, and 11g of fat each. For $2.14 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 18 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. Head to the store and pick up butter, olive oil, fillets tilapia, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. With a spoonacular score of 48%, this dish is good. Try Healthy Sheet Pan Tilapian and Veggies + Meal-Prep, Pan-Seared Eggplant with Buttermilk Dressing, and Pan-Seared Tuna Steaks with Tomato Spinach Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapia works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Maysaran Arsheen Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Maysara Arsheen Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A bright expression of fruit right up front, greeting your palate with notes of cut grass on a warm day. The wine is anchored by crisp acidity, but not so much as to overpower a fleeting tease of sweetness that leaves you smiling. Arsheen has a smart, refreshing character that will bestow clarity to a range of preparations of fish, fowl, and pork.

instructions: Rinse tilapia fillets in cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Season both sides of each fillet with salt and pepper. Place the flour in a shallow dish; gently press each fillet into the flour to coat and shake off the excess flour.                            Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; cook the tilapia in the hot oil until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 4 minutes per side. Brush the melted butter onto the tilapia in the last minute before removing from the skillet. Serve immediately.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Rinse tilapia fillets in cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Season both sides of each fillet with salt and pepper.
Place the flour in a shallow dish; gently press each fillet into the flour to coat and shake off the excess flour.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; cook the tilapia in the hot oil until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 4 minutes per side.
Brush the melted butter onto the tilapia in the last minute before removing from the skillet.
